div.p: Z71/6820, unit 533, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In compliance with your instructions I have the honor to submit an estimate of the expenditure, which I would recommend for the service of the botanic Garden during the next financial year (from 1 July 1871 til 30 June 1872)

Governments
sic.
Botanist and Director of the botanic Garden

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p:
The Director is obliged to provide scientific books, journals, instruments, office light, expenses for foreign agencies, many transit expenses abroad, nearly all the means for his conveyance, a horse and many other outlays from his salary, no allowances of any kind having ever been granted. Though in successive years records of quarters to the Director did appear on the estimates, such quarters are not not
repeated?
really provided, the building, in which he endeavoured to accommodate himself being entirely required for the departmental service, and thus not even a single private room available to the Director.

div.p: In comparing this proposed estimate with that of the last 1 1/2 years it will be observed, that a saving of £250 is proposed, by abolishing the functions, which the forest Inspector exercised at the bot. Garden during the above period, it being respectfully recommended that the duties of this officer may be restricted to forest work under the hon. the Minister of Lands solely. An addition of £100 cannot be avoided in the new estimate under publishing works, the above sum being due since the beginning of the year to the President of the Linnean Society of London, in continuance of an official stipulation entered into some years ago.

I deem it also advisable to bring under the consideration of the ministerial Chief, that my Department should refund henceforth to the Industrial Schools the actual expenditure for the maintenance of the orphan-boys,
this is a turnaround so maybe M meant it as one word.
which the hon. the Chief Secretary may allow to work here also in future, and for this purpose perhaps a rate of payment by the week or month might be fixed. F
MS annotation: 'F It is almost superfluous to remark that for such payment to the orphan boys a special sum would require to be additionally provided.'
